org.platanios.learn.classification

Class AbstractTrainableLogisticRegression.AbstractBuilder<T extends AbstractTrainableLogisticRegression.AbstractBuilder<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.platanios.learn.classification.LogisticRegressionPrediction.AbstractBuilder<T>
      • org.platanios.learn.classification.AbstractTrainableLogisticRegression.AbstractBuilder<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - This type corresponds to the type of the final object to be built. That is, the super class of the builder class that extends this class, which in this case will be the LogisticRegressionSGD class.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractTrainableLogisticRegression.Builder, LogisticRegressionAdaGrad.AbstractBuilder, LogisticRegressionSGD.AbstractBuilder
    Enclosing class:
    AbstractTrainableLogisticRegression

    protected abstract static class AbstractTrainableLogisticRegression.AbstractBuilder<T extends AbstractTrainableLogisticRegression.AbstractBuilder<T>>
extends LogisticRegressionPrediction.AbstractBuilder<T>
    This abstract class needs to be extended by the builder of its parent binary logistic regression class. It provides an implementation for those parts of those builders that are common. This is basically part of a small "hack" so that we can have inheritable builder classes.

      Constructs a builder object for a binary logistic regression model and loads the model parameters (i.e., the weight vectors from the provided input stream.

    • Field Detail

      • useL1Regularization

        protected boolean useL1Regularization
        Indicates whether /(L_1/) regularization is used.

      • l1RegularizationWeight

        protected double l1RegularizationWeight
        The /(L_1/) regularization weight used. This variable is only used when useL1Regularization is set to true.

      • useL2Regularization

        protected boolean useL2Regularization
        Indicates whether /(L_2/) regularization is used.

      • l2RegularizationWeight

        protected double l2RegularizationWeight
        The /(L_2/) regularization weight used. This variable is only used when useL2Regularization is set to true.

      • loggingLevel

        protected int loggingLevel

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractBuilder

        protected AbstractBuilder(int numberOfFeatures)
        Constructs a builder object for a binary logistic regression model that will be trained with the provided training data. This constructor should be used if the logistic regression model that is being built is going to be trained.
        Parameters:
        numberOfFeatures - The number of features used.

      • AbstractBuilder

        protected AbstractBuilder(int numberOfFeatures,
                          java.io.ObjectInputStream inputStream)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a builder object for a binary logistic regression model and loads the model parameters (i.e., the weight vectors from the provided input stream. This constructor should be used if the logistic regression model that is being built is going to be used for making predictions alone (i.e., no training is supported).
        Parameters:
        numberOfFeatures - The number of features used.
        inputStream - The input stream from which to read the model parameters from.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • useL1Regularization

        public T useL1Regularization(boolean useL1Regularization)
        Sets the useL1Regularization field that indicates whether /(L_1/) regularization is used.
        Parameters:
        useL1Regularization - The value to which to set the useL1Regularization field.
        Returns:
        This builder object itself. That is done so that we can use a nice and expressive code format when we build objects using this builder class.

      • l1RegularizationWeight

        public T l1RegularizationWeight(double l1RegularizationWeight)
        Sets the l1RegularizationWeight field that contains the value of the /(L_1/) regularization weight used. This variable is only used when useL1Regularization is set to true.
        Parameters:
        l1RegularizationWeight - The value to which to set the l1RegularizationWeight field.
        Returns:
        This builder object itself. That is done so that we can use a nice and expressive code format when we build objects using this builder class.
